author: Stephanie Becerra
title: chevron-right
text:
Former Pflugerville PD detective charged with tampering with government records by Stephanie Becerra
Fri, August 2nd 2024 at 10:40 PM Updated Fri, August 2nd 2024 at 3:58 PM Booking photo of Tara Schafer. (Photo: CBS Austin) TOPICS:
Pflugerville Tampering Government records Tara Schafer Detective Arrested Deleted Felony PFLUGERVILLE, Texas — The Pflugerville Police Department said a former detective was arrested and charged with tampering with government records after deleting hundreds of filed without permission.
Court records reveal Tara Schafer, 35, deleted files that were associated with her husband Tyler, who was fired from the Pflugerville Police Department in June.
ALSO| Austin ISD music teacher arrested on charges of indecency with a child
She told police that on June 11 she accessed her husband's "G" Drive folder and copied them to a personal hard drive. She also said that after being notified by the department's Internal Affairs' of the pending investigation, she deleted all the files from her drive.
Tampering with government records without authorization is a third-degree felony.
